Content-type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-transfer-encoding: 8BIT

To simply crawl a couple of websites you do not need to write code at all.

Simply follow the first few steps in the user manual:
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html

On linux the important steps are:
1. Download the compiled version
2. Untar it into a directory (lets call it INSTALL here)
3. go into INSTALL
4. export HERITRIX_HOME=`pwd`
5. go into bin
6. chmod 744 *
7. start heritrix with: './heritrix -pPORTNUMBER' (-p not nessecary if 
you can use the default port 8080)
8. open a webbrowser at: http://localhost:8080
9. login with 'admin/letmein'
10. configure your crawl - use the default profiles (remember to set 
user-agent-field and e-mail-adress at the settings-tab) - put in your seeds
11. on the frontpage of the UI click 'start crawling pending jobs'
12. enjoy

best
Bjarne Andersen
